intro: Micromeria graeca var. consentina, commonly known as the Greek micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
